p: Understanding individualsâ€™ behavior and their relationship to their perceived risk is important in terms of effective control of an outbreak of infectious diseases [ 17]. Some studies have examined risk perceptions and precautionary behaviors during the early stages of the 2009 (H1N1) influenza pandemic in Hong Kong [ 18, 19], Australia [ 20], France [ 21, 22], and the England, Scotland, and Wales [ 20]. These studies found that precautionary behaviors were associated with anxiety about H1N1 influenza, risk perceptions, perceived efficacy of the precautionary behaviors [ 19, 23].
